intro: Acinodendron parvifolium, commonly known as the small-leaved acinodendron, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of white to pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests or undergrowth. The fruit is a small, capsule-like structure that contains several seeds.
